name: Anxiety Depression
title: Anxiety Depression

api_list.name: /state
api_list.description: The 'state' endpoint of the 'AnxietyDepression' API provides a range of options in the form of an array of strings. This endpoint gives you all the possible values related to different states. By accessing this endpoint, you can retrieve information about various states without going through multiple sources or conducting extensive research. For instance, if you are interested in knowing the different states within the United States, this endpoint will provide you with a comprehensive list. It allows you to easily fetch information about states like California, New York, Texas, and more. Similarly, if you need information about states like Missouri, Michigan, or any other state, this endpoint will help you access the relevant data efficiently. Overall, the 'state' endpoint simplifies the process of obtaining a complete collection of state names, making it valuable for various applications and analyses.

api_list.name: /dataListIndex
api_list.description: The endpoint 'dataListIndex' from the 'AnxietyDepression' API provides a user-friendly way to access a list of different categories or options related to the field 'dataListIndex'. When you make a request to this endpoint, you will receive an array of strings representing all the possible values for 'dataListIndex'.For example, these values could correspond to specific areas or topics related to anxiety and depression, such as different therapy techniques, symptoms, coping strategies, or types of medication. Each string in the array represents a unique identifier or label for a particular category or option.By accessing this endpoint, users can quickly retrieve the available choices for 'dataListIndex' without having to manually input or guess the options. This can be particularly useful when building applications or interfaces that require this information, facilitating a seamless user experience.Please note that the specific examples provided (3321, 9733, 7355) are just placeholders and not representative of the actual values you would receive from the endpoint.

api_list.name: /group
api_list.description: The 'group' endpoint in the AnxietyDepression API provides you with a list of different categories or groups that you can explore related to anxiety and depression. Each category represents a specific aspect or classification of mental health data that you can analyze. These categories are returned as an array of strings, which means you will receive a list of possible values to choose from.The 'group' endpoint allows you to understand and organize the data based on various perspectives or groupings. For example, you can select the 'By State' group to retrieve data specific to different states, enabling you to compare anxiety and depression statistics across different geographical areas. Another option could be to select the 'By Disability status' group, which provides insights into how anxiety and depression affect individuals with different disability statuses.By utilizing the 'group' endpoint, you can gain a deeper understanding of anxiety and depression by exploring and analyzing data from various angles. This can assist researchers, mental health professionals, and policymakers in identifying patterns, trends, and potential interventions to address these mental health concerns effectively.

api_list.name: /indicator
api_list.description: The 'indicator' endpoint in the AnxietyDepression API provides a list of options that describe different indicators or symptoms related to anxiety and depression. By making a request to this endpoint, you will receive an array of strings that represent these indicators.These indicators help identify various aspects of anxiety and depressive disorders. The endpoint returns values like 'Symptoms of Anxiety Disorder' or 'Symptoms of Depressive Disorder,' which suggest the signs someone may experience when dealing with these conditions.For instance, one indicator might describe the symptoms specific to anxiety disorder, while another could focus on the symptoms related to depressive disorder. Additionally, there may be indicators that cover symptoms common to both anxiety and depression. These indicators act as key descriptors to better understand and categorize the experiences of individuals facing anxiety or depressive disorders.By utilizing the 'indicator' endpoint, users can gain valuable insights into the various signs and symptoms associated with anxiety and depression, helping them better identify and address these mental health conditions.

api_list.name: /highCi
api_list.description: The 'highCi' endpoint from the AnxietyDepression API provides an array of strings that represent different levels of confidence intervals for anxiety and depression measurements. Confidence intervals indicate the level of certainty in the accuracy of these measurements.Each value in the array corresponds to a specific high confidence interval, although the actual values may vary. The endpoint provides a range of potential values between 0 and 100, where higher values indicate a greater level of confidence in the measurement. These values allow researchers, healthcare professionals, and individuals to assess the reliability and precision of anxiety and depression data obtained through the API.By analyzing the 'highCi' endpoint's values, one can gain insights into the degree of certainty associated with anxiety and depression measurements, helping to identify trends, make informed decisions, and provide appropriate support or treatment.

api_list.name: /timePeriodStartDate
api_list.description: The 'timePeriodStartDate' endpoint from the 'AnxietyDepression' API provides a user-friendly way to access a range of date options for a specific field. When making a request to this endpoint, you will receive an array of strings, each representing a possible value for the 'timePeriodStartDate' field. These values correspond to different dates that can be selected as the starting point for a time period.By utilizing this endpoint, users can easily fetch all the available date options and present them in a user interface, making it convenient to select a desired start date for their analysis or data retrieval purposes. The provided examples, such as '09/30/2020', '03/30/2022', and '07/06/2021', demonstrate the format in which the dates are returned.With the 'timePeriodStartDate' endpoint, developers can streamline the process of choosing appropriate start dates, enhancing the usability and efficiency of their applications utilizing the 'AnxietyDepression' API.

api_list.name: /timePeriodLabel
api_list.description: The endpoint 'timePeriodLabel' from the 'AnxietyDepression' API provides a range of time periods expressed as strings. These strings represent the labels or names for different time intervals or spans. With this endpoint, you can retrieve an array of these labels, which are various combinations of dates and month names.These labels help in categorizing and identifying specific time periods within the data provided by the API. Each label represents a distinct time range, and you can use them to understand when particular information or data points were recorded or measured.For instance, the 'timePeriodLabel' may include labels like 'January 2020', 'Spring 2021', or 'Q3 2019' to represent time periods associated with specific data sets. These labels make it easier to organize and analyze the information based on different time frames, such as days, weeks, months, or even years.By utilizing the 'timePeriodLabel' endpoint, developers or users can get a comprehensive list of these time period labels, which can be helpful in filtering or visualizing data based on specific time ranges of interest.

api_list.name: /subgroup
api_list.description: The 'subgroup' endpoint from the 'AnxietyDepression' API provides a list of different categories or subgroups related to anxiety and depression. These categories represent various characteristics or demographics that individuals can fall into. For example, these subgroups might include different states or regions like Missouri or Michigan or specific groups like those without disability. By accessing this endpoint, you can retrieve an array of strings containing all the possible values for the 'subgroup' field. This information can be useful for analyzing data or filtering results based on particular subgroups of interest. Whether you are a researcher studying anxiety and depression patterns in different regions or a developer building an application that focuses on specific subgroups, this endpoint provides valuable insights into the diverse factors associated with anxiety and depression.

api_list.name: /value
api_list.description: The 'value' endpoint from the AnxietyDepression API provides a range of values that represent different levels of anxiety and depression. These values are displayed as an array of strings. The endpoint helps users understand and gauge the intensity of anxiety and depression based on the provided values.By using this endpoint, individuals can access a wide range of potential values that fall within this spectrum of mental health. The values can be used to track and monitor personal feelings of anxiety and depression over time, allowing for a better understanding of one's emotional well-being.It is important to note that the values returned by this endpoint are not fixed or standardized measurements, but rather provide a relative indication of anxiety and depression levels. Each value may represent a unique individual experience, and it is recommended to consult with a mental health professional for accurate diagnosis and treatment.

api_list.name: /timePeriod
api_list.description: The 'timePeriod' endpoint in the AnxietyDepression API provides a collection of strings representing different time periods. These time periods are potential options for categorizing or indicating the duration of anxiety or depression-related data. For example, some of the possible values returned by this endpoint could be 'weekly', 'monthly', 'yearly', 'quarterly', 'daily', or 'lifelong'. These strings can help users better understand and analyze anxiety or depression data based on specific timeframes.By using the 'timePeriod' endpoint, developers can integrate this valuable feature into their applications or systems, enabling users to customize their queries or filters based on desired time intervals. This endpoint plays a significant role in enhancing the functionality and flexibility of applications that utilize the AnxietyDepression API, empowering users to effectively track and manage anxiety or depression trends over various time periods that suit their needs.

api_list.name: /lowCi
api_list.description: The 'lowCi' endpoint from the AnxietyDepression API returns an array of strings that represent the possible values for the field 'lowCi'. This field is related to measuring the lower confidence interval of data related to anxiety and depression. The values in the array can range from very low to high, indicating different levels of certainty in the data.The 'lowCi' values give insights into the statistical reliability of the information provided by the API. These values can help professionals and researchers understand the range within which the data may lie, allowing them to make more informed decisions or draw conclusions.It is important to note that the specific values mentioned earlier (27.4 and 16.3) are just examples and not actual values returned by the endpoint. The actual values for 'lowCi' in the API's response may differ based on the data being analyzed.

api_list.name: /quartileRange
api_list.description: The 'quartileRange' endpoint from the 'AnxietyDepression' API provides an array of strings that represent the possible values for a statistical measurement called the quartile range. The quartile range is a way to divide a set of data into four equal parts, where each part contains 25% of the data.Imagine you have a dataset of numbers, such as test scores. The quartile range helps you understand the spread or variability of these scores. The endpoint returns a range in the form of two numbers separated by a hyphen (-), where the first number represents the lower quartile and the second number represents the upper quartile.For instance, if the endpoint returns '10.5-15.2' as a value, it means that the lower quartile of the data falls between 10.5 and 15.2, and the upper quartile falls between 15.2 and 20.3. This range implies that 50% of the data falls within these values, while the remaining 50% lies outside this range.The 'quartileRange' endpoint provides insights into how the data is distributed and helps in understanding the spread of values for a particular field in the AnxietyDepression API.

api_list.name: /confidenceInterval
api_list.description: The 'confidenceInterval' endpoint in the AnxietyDepression API provides a range of values that helps in understanding the reliability of data related to anxiety and depression. This endpoint returns an array of strings, where each string represents a specific confidence interval. A confidence interval is a statistical measure that indicates the certainty of the data being within a specific range.By using this endpoint, users can analyze and interpret the provided confidence intervals to gain insights into the precision of the collected data. The confidence intervals often consist of two values - a lower and an upper bound, separated by a hyphen. These values show the range within which the actual data might lie.For instance, an example confidence interval could be '27.4 - 34.1'. This suggests that there is a certain level of confidence that the true value associated with anxiety or depression lies somewhere between 27.4 and 34.1. Another example could be '16.3 - 22.0', indicating that the estimated data falls within this range with a certain degree of confidence.Users can utilize these confidence intervals to assess the reliability and accuracy of the provided data, helping them make informed decisions and draw meaningful conclusions from the AnxietyDepression API.

api_list.name: /timePeriodEndDate
api_list.description: The 'timePeriodEndDate' endpoint in the 'AnxietyDepression' API provides a user-friendly way to retrieve a list of possible values for the field 'timePeriodEndDate'. This field represents the end date of a specific time period related to anxiety and depression data. The endpoint returns an array of strings, which are the different possible values for this field. These values represent dates in a specific format, such as 'mm/dd/yyyy'. By accessing this endpoint, users can retrieve a comprehensive list of available end dates for reference or analysis purposes. It allows users to gather insights or perform calculations based on the specific time periods represented by each 'timePeriodEndDate' value. This information can be valuable for researchers, analysts, or anyone interested in studying anxiety and depression trends over time.

api_list.name: /phase
api_list.description: The 'phase' endpoint from the AnxietyDepression API provides a list of different phases that are associated with anxiety and depression. These phases represent different stages or states that individuals may experience during their struggle with anxiety or depression. Each phase is represented as a string, which is a sequence of characters. This endpoint returns an array of these strings, meaning it provides a comprehensive list of all possible values for the 'phase' field. By using this endpoint, users can gather useful information about the different phases that people may go through when dealing with anxiety and depression. Understanding these phases can help individuals identify and relate to their own experiences, as well as gain insights into the journey towards recovery. Whether someone is seeking support or simply looking to educate themselves, this endpoint serves as a valuable resource in providing a better understanding of the various phases associated with anxiety and depression.

api_list.name: /records
api_list.description: The 'records' endpoint is the heart of the AnxietyDepression API, providing users with a valuable array of objects that hold information related to the query parameters. This endpoint acts as a gateway to accessing a comprehensive collection of data pertaining to anxiety and depression. By utilizing the 'records' endpoint, users can gain insights and understanding about various aspects of these mental health conditions.The array of objects returned by this endpoint holds rows of information that are tailored to the user's specific needs. These rows contain relevant data such as symptoms, treatments, coping mechanisms, and personal experiences shared by others who have dealt with anxiety or depression. The 'records' endpoint strives to offer users a diverse range of information, ensuring that individuals can find relatable content and gain a broader understanding of these mental health challenges.Whether looking for real-life stories, discovering effective treatments, or exploring coping strategies, the 'records' endpoint presents users with a user-friendly interface to access the vast knowledge and experiences related to anxiety and depression. By encompassing various perspectives and information, this API encourages individuals to connect, learn, and find comfort in shared experiences as they navigate their journey towards improved mental well-being.
